Key Match Events: Cleveland was able to move its win streak to 11 despite Donovan Mitchell scoring only 11 points on 3-of-16 shooting.
Gilgeous-Alexander finished with a game-high 31 points and nine assists.
The loss snapped a 15-game win streak for the Thunder
Post-Match Reflections: Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson acknowledged there were doubts about Cleveland's ability to win this game, and whether this team is truly as good as its record shows. But in a game in which Mitchell went 3-for-16, Cleveland was able to beat an Oklahoma City team that had won 15 games in a row and is seen as a true title contender.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The score was rarely beyond two possessions throughout
Others: Cleveland fans erupt after Darius Garland's clutch basket puts the game away vs. the Thunder.
